title: Bank of China contributes to $1.8 billion syndicated receivables-backed trade finance facility to COCOBOD for its 2016/2017 crop season financing needs
description: On September 21, 2016, a consortium of 25 financial institutions — including Bank of China (BOC) — finalized a $1.8 billion receivables-backed trade finance facility (loan) agreement with Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD), a state-owned enterprise and the world's second largest cocoa producer, for purchasing cocoa from farmers during the 2016/2017 crop season. The 25 participants in the loan syndicate included Deutsche Bank AG, Nedbank Ltd., Standard Chartered Bank, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ, Natixis, Rabobank, Société Générale, DZ Bank, ABN Amro bank N.V., Attijariwafa Bank Europe, Bank of China (London), Barclays Bank Ghana Ltd., Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Deutsche Bank AG, DZ Bank AG Deutsche ZentralGenossenchaftbank, Ecobank Ghana, Sumitomo-Mitsui Banking Corporation, KfW Impex-Bank GmbH, Intesa SanPaolo SpA, Mizuho Bank, Rand Merchant Bank, Ghana International Bank Plc, S.G Ghana Ltd., State Bank of India (London), and Fidelity bnk Ghana Ltd.   The borrowing terms included a 1-year repayment period and an interest rate of LIBOR plus 67.5  basis points. The Government of Ghana issued a sovereign guarantee in support of the loan. The loan was also secured by (i.e. collateralized against) receivables from future cocoa sales contracts.  The first tranche of the loan was disbursed on October 4, 2016. COCOBOD successfully repaid the loan in full — with interest.
staff_comments: 1. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate by adding 0.675% to the average LIBOR rate in September 2016 (1.247%). 2. The individual contributions of the banks that participated in the lending syndicate are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($72 million) across all 25 members of the syndicate.3. Ghana’s cocoa production is regulated by the Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD), an organization separate from the Ministry of Food and Agriculture that is wholly owned by the Government of Ghana. COCOBOD does not purchase any of the cocoa which is exported, but is responsible for assuring the quality of the product. To ensure the high quality of Ghana’s cocoa exports, the COCOBOD oversees horticulture practices and regulates the use of pesticides and fertilizer. In addition, COCOBOD sets the producer prices for cocoa farmers and, through a subsidiary, oversees the marketing of cocoa. The operations of the COCOBOD are funded through the receipt of a percentage of the revenue received from cocoa exports, but all profits after covering expenses are passed onto the Government of Ghana in the form of export taxes. 4. In August 2017, COCOBOD told the country’s parliament it was in financial distress due to obligations that included servicing China Eximbank loans for the Bui Dam Construction Project (captured via Project ID#183, ID#30801, ID#30709, and ID#30086). 5. Some sources suggest that there were 23 rather than 25 members of the lending syndicate. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
Bank of China contributes to $1.8 billion syndicated receivables-backed trade finance facility to COCOBOD for its 2016/2017 crop season financing needs

# Description
On September 21, 2016, a consortium of 25 financial institutions — including Bank of China (BOC) — finalized a $1.8 billion receivables-backed trade finance facility (loan) agreement with Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD), a state-owned enterprise and the world's second largest cocoa producer, for purchasing cocoa from farmers during the 2016/2017 crop season. The 25 participants in the loan syndicate included Deutsche Bank AG, Nedbank Ltd., Standard Chartered Bank, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ, Natixis, Rabobank, Société Générale, DZ Bank, ABN Amro bank N.V., Attijariwafa Bank Europe, Bank of China (London), Barclays Bank Ghana Ltd., Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Deutsche Bank AG, DZ Bank AG Deutsche ZentralGenossenchaftbank, Ecobank Ghana, Sumitomo-Mitsui Banking Corporation, KfW Impex-Bank GmbH, Intesa SanPaolo SpA, Mizuho Bank, Rand Merchant Bank, Ghana International Bank Plc, S.G Ghana Ltd., State Bank of India (London), and Fidelity bnk Ghana Ltd.   The borrowing terms included a 1-year repayment period and an interest rate of LIBOR plus 67.5  basis points. The Government of Ghana issued a sovereign guarantee in support of the loan. The loan was also secured by (i.e. collateralized against) receivables from future cocoa sales contracts.  The first tranche of the loan was disbursed on October 4, 2016. COCOBOD successfully repaid the loan in full — with interest.
justification: The project is a trade finance facility for cocoa production, which does not have a direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Receivables-backed trade finance facility for cocoa crop season financing, no direct energy or environmental components

title: Chinese Bilateral Training Program on Stadium Maintenance Technology for Grenadians in 2016
description: In May 2016, Chinese government selected 20 Grenadians to receive the bilateral training in China in the seminar titled "Stadium Maintenance Technology." An orientation was held on May 18 at the Grenada national cricket stadium. The orientation was attended by Chinese Ambassador to Grenada Ou Boquian, Grenadian Senior HR Management Officer Carina Aird, and other Grenadian government representatives. The participants will leave for Heifei, China on May 25 and return June 16, 2016. The Bilateral programs aim to build skill and job capacity.
combined_text:

The orientation was attended by Chinese Ambassador to Grenada Ou Boquian, Grenadian Senior HR Management Officer Carina Aird, and other Grenadian government representatives. The participants will leave for Heifei, China on May 25 and return June 16, 2016. The Bilateral programs aim to build skill and job capacity.
justification: Project focuses on capacity building and education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training program on stadium maintenance technology, skill and job capacity building focus

title: Chinese Government provides $7,803 grant to support the Governor General’s Office in 2016
description: According to internal records that the Government of Grenada shared with AidData in June 2018, the Chinese Government provided a $7,803 grant to the Government of Grenada in 2016 to support the Governor General's Office.
staff_comments: 1. The main source (see Dropbox link) was provided to AidData by a Ministry of Finance official in Grenada.

title: Chinese Government Medical Equipment Donation in 2016
description: On May 19, 2016, the Chinese Embassy in Grenada handed over a donation of medical equipment to the Ministry of Health in Grenada. The donation included beds, surgical instruments, and accessories for the operating room, emergency room, and admission room. At the ceremony, Chinese Ambassador to Granada Ou Boquian gave the equipment over to Grenadian Minister of Health Nicholas Steel and Grenadian Foreign Affairs Minister Clarice Modeste-Curwen.

title: 25 Recipients for 2016 China-Grenada Annual Scholarship Awards (linked to #54962, #54959)
description: On August 11th, 2016, Grenada's Ministry of Education held the award ceremony of the China-aided Grenada Annual scholarship Awards at Grenada Boys Secondary School. 25 applicants of the scholarship received the opportunity to study abroad in China to pursue undergraduate and master's degrees. Chinese Ambassador Ou Boqian and Grenadian Minister of Education Anthony Boatswain attended the ceremony. An orientation was held on August 13 for the scholarship awardees before they left for China, attended by government officials and scholarship alumni.
staff_comments: This project is linked to Projects #54962 and #54959, which detail the Scholarship Awards for 2014 and 2015.

title: Chinese Government provides assistance for Agricultural Experts Complex (Linked to Project ID#54764)
description: With assistance from the Chinese Government, Grenada built an Agricultural Experts Complex to upgrade their technology and improve the working conditions of local farmers. Shanxi No.4 Engineering and Construction Company started the construction in December 2016, and was expected to finish in October 2017. The handover ceremony was held on December 6, 2017 and attended by government officials, construction officials, and individuals invested in agriculture. The building will house activities such as research, seed and seedling cultivation, agricultural training and promotion, conferences, and office space.
staff_comments: 1. This project is linked to Umbrella Project ID#54764. It ties into the wider Grenada Agricultural Technical Cooperation Project effort established from 2005 which aims to share agricultural technology and knowledge between China and Grenada. 2. Given that this project is described by official sources as 'China-aided', AidData assumes that it was funded through a MOFCOM grant or interest-free loan. The flow_class field is therefore set to ODA-Like because the project has development intent and grants and interest-free loans from MOFCOM always exceed the OECD concessionality threshold of 25%
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides assistance for Agricultural Experts Complex (Linked to Project ID#54764)

# Description
With assistance from the Chinese Government, Grenada built an Agricultural Experts Complex to upgrade their technology and improve the working conditions of local farmers. Shanxi No.4 Engineering and Construction Company started the construction in December 2016, and was expected to finish in October 2017. The handover ceremony was held on December 6, 2017 and attended by government officials, construction officials, and individuals invested in agriculture. The building will house activities such as research, seed and seedling cultivation, agricultural training and promotion, conferences, and office space.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural development and capacity building without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural Experts Complex, research and training facilities, focus on agricultural technology improvement

title: Chinese Government dispatches 26th medical team to Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital
description: The Chinese Government has sent the Republic of Guinea 26 medical teams since 1968. The 26th medical team consisted of 19 members (17 medical experts, a translator, and a chef) from a hospital in Beijing. They were stationed at the Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital (Hôpital De L'amitié Sino-Guinéen), which is located in Kipé district and the municipality of Ratoma. The team completed its term of service between July 12, 2017 and December 24, 2018.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 援几内亚第26批医疗队. The 26th medical team was the fourth Chinese medical team to be stationed at the Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital, which was constructed with grant funding from the Chinese Government (see project #13330) and handed over to the local authorities on April 13, 2011.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 26th medical team to Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital

# Description
The Chinese Government has sent the Republic of Guinea 26 medical teams since 1968. The 26th medical team consisted of 19 members (17 medical experts, a translator, and a chef) from a hospital in Beijing. They were stationed at the Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital (Hôpital De L'amitié Sino-Guinéen), which is located in Kipé district and the municipality of Ratoma. The team completed its term of service between July 12, 2017 and December 24, 2018.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare provision without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospital, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Government donates security equipment to Guinea's Ministry of Security and Civil Protection
description: On August 19, 2016, the Chinese Ambassador to Guinea, Bian Jianqiang attended a ceremony for the donation of security equipment to Guinea's Ministry of Security and Civil Protection. This assistance was aimed to help the ministry build its capacity, improve its working conditions, and to strengthen Guinea's police force. The project was completed with the handover ceremony on August 19, 2016.
combined_text:

GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

On August 19, 2016, the Chinese Ambassador to Guinea, Bian Jianqiang attended a ceremony for the donation of security equipment to Guinea's Ministry of Security and Civil Protection. This assistance was aimed to help the ministry build its capacity, improve its working conditions, and to strengthen Guinea's police force. The project was completed with the handover ceremony on August 19, 2016.
justification: Project involves donation of security equipment to support government capacity building, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Security equipment donation, capacity building for Ministry of Security and Civil Protection

title: Chinese Government cancels $30 million of Government of Guinea-Bissau’s outstanding debt obligations
description: In October 2016, the Chinese Government forgave $30 million of the Government of Guinea-Bissau’s outstanding debt obligations. The debts were forgiven on the basis of solidarity and an act of China's efforts to strengthen ties with Portuguese-speaking African nations.
staff_comments: 1. This debt cancellation is not included in the dataset of Chinese debt cancellations and restructurings released by SAIS-CARI in 2020.2. The loans forgiven through this action were almost certainly interest-free loans committed through previous ETCAs. As such, the loans likely had maturity lengths of 20 years and since they had reached maturity no later than 2016, they were likely contracted prior to 2000. Therefore, AidData has not assigned this record to the umbrella category (as there is little risk of double counting the monetary value of the debts that were forgiven).
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
Chinese Government cancels $30 million of Government of Guinea-Bissau’s outstanding debt obligations

# Description
In October 2016, the Chinese Government forgave $30 million of the Government of Guinea-Bissau’s outstanding debt obligations. The debts were forgiven on the basis of solidarity and an act of China's efforts to strengthen ties with Portuguese-speaking African nations.
justification: Debt forgiveness is a financial transaction without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Debt cancellation of $30 million, described as an act of solidarity and diplomatic relations

title: China donated medication to Canchungo hospital in Guinea-Bissau
description: On May 19, 2016, Chinese Ambassador to Guinea-Bissau Wang attended a ceremony commemorating a $12,000 donation of medication to the Canchungo hospital, located 72 kilometers from the nation’s capital Bissau. During the ceremony, Wang stated “This support demonstrates the existing friendship between the two countries." The medication was handed over to the hospital on May 19, 2016.
combined_text:

HEALTH

During the ceremony, Wang stated “This support demonstrates the existing friendship between the two countries." The medication was handed over to the hospital on May 19, 2016.
justification: Project involves donation of medication to a hospital, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medication donation to Canchungo hospital, healthcare sector focus
